intro: Rhinanthus wagneri, commonly known as Wagner's blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its showy yellow-orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a fibrous root system and is often found in association with other native wildflowers.
